ygData.subject: Re: lock contention in ServerCache.getServerFor()

Hi Paul,

this sounds like some rather interesting modifications - would yo=
u
mind to share your changes as a diff patch?

Best regards
  Olaf Freyer

=
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "pbaclace" <pbaclace@...> wrote:
>
=
> The "un-knotting" performance change worked.  I see a 2X speedup in
> her=
itrix v1.14.2:
> 
> * 460KB/sec (from 230KB/sec) network usage
> * 100% cpu=
 with load between 15-19 (as reported by "w" in linux)
> * disk usage at 60=
0KB/sec (from 300KB/sec) 
> * number of established HTTP sockets:  25 (an a=
verage from 13 netstats)
> 
> Basically, the same run took half the time.  =
As long as logging is not
> verbose, the TOE worker threads are blocked on =
writing the WARC files.
>  (Actually, this job writes out both WARC and ARC=
, so it could be
> improved.) 
> 
> The high load number might seem scary t=
o some people, but it just
> means the cpu is fully utilized and more cores=
 could help.
> 
> It requires edits to 3 files plus 3 other files need triv=
ial changes.
>  The un-knotting has not yet been tested against: multi-core=
,
> multi-processor, checkpointing, and recovery.
> 
> 
> Paul
> 
>
